main event: A civilian observed a circular unidentified flying object in St. Petersburg, Florida on 22 September 1956.
interesting points: The object was described as having a dull gray metallic surface and emitting a blue-white glow., The observer estimated the size to be about 30 feet in diameter., The object was observed to be rotating slowly and moving to the west before disappearing., The sighting lasted several minutes and was made while moving furniture., There were no significant astrological bodies present at the time of the sighting, leading to conclusions of insufficient data.
sighted object: circular object with a dull gray metallic surface
witness description: a male, white civilian, approximately 60 years old, considered a reliable observer with experience as a control tower operator at a U.S. Air Force Base
